name: The Conservation Evidence database
description: This database summarises evidence from the scientific literature (studies) about the effects of conservation actions such as methods of habitat or species management. The dataset contains synopses of evidence that review the effectiveness of all actions which could be implemented to conserve a given species group or habitat or to tackle a particular conservation issue. Expert panels are then asked to assess the effectiveness (or not) of actions, based on the summarized evidence. The database also contains summaries of actions proposed in farmland conservation.
data_ownership: Department of Zoology, University of Cambridge, United Kingdom
data_project_name:
Conservation Evidence is based at the University of Cambridge, UK, with collaborators and advisers in all continents of the world. The project was conceived by William J. Sutherland and is managed by Rebecca K Smith.
The funding of the Miriam Rothschild Chair in Conservation Biology through Arcadia enabled the development of the website and funds the Managing Editor of the Conservation Evidence Journal.
